data.title: AMD Radeon -- layering does not work?
data.body:
Layering does not work. Main menu is shown incorrect and flickers.
http://oi45.tinypic.com/1ph2e0.jpg

Other symptoms:
- It's impossible to read most of the button labels.
- There is no background image of the menu, but the corners of the rectangle are visible.
- The cursor has a shadow to the left of the real mouse. (See upper-right on the screenshot.)
- other game graphics in the main menu are cool. Units move smooth, fast, without any delays.

Ubuntu 11.04 natty.

installed packages: mono-runtime, mono-gmcs, libfreetype6, libmono-corlib1.0-cil, libmono-winforms2.0-cil, libopenal1, libsdl1.2-dev, nvidia-cg-toolkit

OpenGL renderer string: AMD Radeon HD 6300 series Graphics

launching with  "Graphics.Renderer=Cg" does not help. Seems like it doesn't change anything.

screenshot from a launched game:
http://oi46.tinypic.com/23mrnkn.jpg

data.title: Walls are cut off when sold.
data.body: A minor graphical issue reported at http://forum.dune2k.com/topic/24184-opend2k-cross-platform-reimplementation-of-dune-2000/page__st__120#entry375094 (with screenshot).

data.title: Set up tran husks, and stop husk placement causing crashes
[d2k] building on different terrain should change HP
data.body: In Dune 2000 building on concrete plates (issue #2249) gives you 100% health while building on rock reduces to 50%. In Dune II your buildings even slowly deteriorate faster without concrete.

data.title: Thumper animation is broken
data.body: Transpose breaks the thumping animation (split into several SHPs as a workaround).

data.title: Deviator weapon does not work well against AI
data.body: The Deviator weapon is weird when playing against the AI as it is still able to control captured units. They are AttackMoving changing directions every 1s. So the AI will attack itself and override your orders. Question is: where is the flaw? Does the HackyAI not care about changed owners or does AttackLoyalty not really enforce owner change. Anyway it should cancel activities because otherwise your captured units will still attack you unless you manually order them around to do something else and it is hard to see that they are on your side already.

data.title: Splatter resources upon destruction
data.body:
In d2k spice blooms should explode and create new spice field instead of growing spice like mines/blossom trees using `SeedsRessources`. The spice blooms reappear at their spawn points in legacy Dune 2000 to avoid limited resources.

This might also be interesting for tiberium/ore/spice silos/refineries/harvesters which can also set their resources free when destroyed.

data.title: D2kExtractGameFiles opens OpenRA.TilesetBuilder.exe GUI
data.body: Put TilesetBuilder.Export into OpenRA.Utility to call the functions directly when extracting game-files (instead of opening a GUI process) just like the R8 extractor. In fact the whole D2kExtractGameFiles.cs does not look too good. This should be done with fewer amounts of repetitive code. It is actually just my RipD2kGameFiles.sh bash script squeezed into OpenRA widgets logic.

data.title: Support Dune 2000 patch 1.06 gamefiles

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body: The http://dune2k.com/Download/30 DATA.R8 from Dune 2000 version 1.06 patch has more frames and currently fails to extract. Using code from http://code.google.com/p/dune2000plusone/source/browse/trunk/Dune2k1/ResourceEditor/ResourceEditor/Form1.cs with explicit permission by mvi and a very permissive license might help. It also adds new terrain tilesets with white houses (it says 2, but I only see 1 namely BLOXXMAS) and new units: grenade thrower with icon, stealth raider icon. Most work might be indexing all the frames manually again as the numbers change.

data.title: Last remap index in d2k mod is mapped to transparency

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
The last team color should be the brightest one. It is currently mapped to transparency. I don't know why and how to fix this. You can see this best at the Atreides Hightech Factory roof: http://imgur.com/c23cI

The last palette index (255 when started counting at 0) mapped to transparency might be a wanted feature for RA palettes. At least XCC Mixer shows a white spot at the last index which has the RGB code 63 63 63 (should be grey).

data.title: [d2k] shellmap is just a blank placeholder
data.body: Who wants to create a nice shellmap or has interesting ideas?

data.title: Add projectiles, muzzles and explosions from Dune 2000
data.body: All the effects currently fall back to RA and use their palette. I annotated `mods/d2k/sequences.yaml` to see which ones are from RA. They have to be indexed in the D2kGameFileExtractor.cs  and scripted in yaml. I can do that, but might need help identifying the images (see http://ijw.co.nz/d2kout.zip for reference) as they are sometimes just some dots. This will get rid of the last RA .mix files making Dune 2000 a truly independent total conversion. There might be a problem as the Dune 2000 explosions are translucent. The worm signs had ugly black borders.

data.title: Drag does not care for SharedCells
data.body: This is annoying because the first movement step on deployment of troops from APC/chinook/water-transport (#2016) and infantry production looks ugly. Don't know how to fix this and why the drag command is even necessary as walking to rally points cares for subcells (uses Mobile.MoveTo).

data.title: Removed RA content dependencies from D2k mod
data.body: I cleaned up this pull request with `git rebase -i openra/bleed`. Only the unmerged commits should be left.

data.title: Fixed structure build menus
data.body:
Made the building menu more logical. Rows according to tech tree.

power / refinery / silos    0/10/15
barracks / outpost / starport  20/30/40
light factory / heavy factory / repair bay  50/60/70
high-tech factory / ix tech center / palace  80/90/100

If you want to move silos to the Defense queue, then I would re-arrange it slightly.

data.title: Sonic tank moved to end of build menu (100)
data.body: Sonic tank moved to bottom of vehicle build menu (set palette order to 100)

data.title: Iron curtain improvements
data.body:
Could:
- increase the duration;
- increase the aoe of selecting units (but still up to 5 max)

and likely should prevent it from affecting enemies

data.title: Dune 2000 fixes
data.body: The last 3 commits are of interest. The rest is repeated. (I probably have to rebase again.)

data.title: Dune2000 crash when deploying 3+ thumpers
data.body:
Hello All,

I'm new to the world of bug reports, so I hope I'm using proper etiquette. 
The problem seems to happen when I deploy three or more Thumpers in close proximity to each other.  The program just quits and exits.  

I'm using Debian-based Crunchbang GNU / Linux and the 20120721 Playtest.    

Exception Log:

```
Exception of type `System.ArgumentNullException`: Argument cannot be null.
Parameter name: second
  at System.Linq.Check.FirstAndSecond (System.Object first, System.Object second) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.Linq.Enumerable.Intersect[String] (IEnumerable`1 first, IEnumerable`1 second, IEqualityComparer`1 comparer) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.Linq.Enumerable.Intersect[String] (IEnumerable`1 first, IEnumerable`1 second) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Mods.RA.CrushableInfantry.CrushableBy (System.String[] crushClasses, OpenRA.Player crushOwner) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Move.Mobile+<FinishedMoving>c__AnonStoreyD7.<>m__142 (ICrushable b) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.Linq.Enumerable+<CreateWhereIterator>c__Iterator1D`1[OpenRA.Traits.ICrushable].MoveNext () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Move.Mobile.FinishedMoving (OpenRA.Actor self) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Move.Mobile.SetPosition (OpenRA.Actor self, CPos cell) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Activities.Leap.Tick (OpenRA.Actor self) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Traits.Util.RunActivity (OpenRA.Actor self, OpenRA.Traits.Activity act) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Actor.Tick () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.World.Tick () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Tick (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Tick (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager, OpenRA.Graphics.Viewport viewPort) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Run () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
```

data.title: Exception Log Errors after Crash when using Tirili's
data.body:
I am on Tirili's branch (Hotkey-Addons#3 at this time) plus some changes i made on my own.

Sometimes, the game crashes to desktop.
I think it happens when i select a unit and set stances with keyboard, but i cannot reproduce it yet fully.

Exception log is:

